page.title: 11PARTRIDGE GREEN LEGENDS
page.content: MR.STAPLES an elderly resident of Partridge Green told us a couple of stories.In 1942 there was a "Rag and Bone Man"named STEVE TAYLOR who lived in a shack on JOLESFIELD COMMON.One day he went to PRETTY'S GARAGE to buy paraffin for his fire.When he returned he poured the contents of the bottle onto his fire,not knowing that it was petrol by mistake.The flames leapt up and he and the shack were burnt down.In 1945 one of MR.STAPLES lodgers,MR.THOMPSON,went out shooting rabbits in another field.That night he did not come back.The next morning MR.STAPLES went to look for him and found him dead under an oak tree.
